title: Information Technology Career Field: Cybersecurity Defense and Reinforcement
subject: CTE

FBC156B698214F26904966D3E47DAA56.description: Implement Governance, risk management and Compliance Management processes (risk mitigation, govern compliance).

8C89AD4FC8D14E9A87ADC0FFAEB35B6D.description: Risk Management: Apply concepts of risk management.

76E02E41CA1C4343BDD46286D37707B2.description: Describe and plan Fault tolerance (e.g., Hardware, RAID, Clustering, Load balancing, Disaster recovery concepts, Backup plans/policies, Backup execution/frequency).

E5E20BA5E3A34D4782BCC5E20F765C25.description: Describe the concepts of Risk assessment (e.g., Disaster recovery plan, IT contingency planning - Succession planning, Redundancy).

9BDD95535E5447EBAC479825E11A548F.description: Describe the concepts of Risk Management (e.g., Business continuity concepts, Business impact analysis, Identification of critical systems and components, Removing single points of failure).

32F8BFD8170E4C9B8FC6350E8DDF4CBD.description: Apply Incident response procedures (e.g., Preparation, Incident identification, Escalation and notification, Mitigation steps, Lessons learned, Reporting, Recovery procedures, First responder, Incident isolation, Quarantine, Device removal, Data breach).

772997ABFC064A0F89FCAF86BD34B2A8.description: Implement a Network Access Control (NAC) plan.

3EC4EB3CA03147EC9AB016923645F606.description: Create, edit and use roles and system management tools.

ED9EEA61CBDD48A3A1303989F1B1970F.description: Differentiate between detection controls and prevention controls (e.g., IDS vs. IPS, Camera vs. guard).

50FF235C522847FE88CC4CB99968AA23.description: Countermeasures: Use countermeasures to monitor systems and reduce risk.

138652C75BB04843BA78971405676D0A.description: Collect digital evidence according to established policies and protocols (e.g., system image, packet captures).

03ACFB6E5FF048A7BD2A2B7FF9D7FC1E.description: Recognize digital reconnaissance techniques (e.g., packet capture, OS fingerprinting, topology discovery, DNS harvesting).

FBCDC53E46C84CC38EC52E24A0DBB106.description: Digital Forensics: Capture and analyze information using digital tools.

F31DAFC864284EEC9C3539E30111CC99.description: Adhere to regulatory and industry standards (e.g., PCIDSS, PADSS).

7FD8771ED61547368C2F34592242CB33.description: Cyber Security Law: Adhere to cyber security laws.

9161C3994614468F8016AC87419F75AC.description: Describe, appraise for, and mitigate Social Engineering attacks (e.g., Shoulder surfing, Dumpster diving, Tailgating, Impersonation, Hoaxes, Phishing, Spear Phishing, Whaling, Vishing, Principles, URL hijacking, Watering Hole).

81FFF4B1E8484D45993C1004D7B63621.description: Configure defenses for Password attacks (e.g., Brute Force, Dictionary attacks, Hybrid, Birthday attacks, Rainbow tables).

F17157EBBDF4416BB3ED34597DE7CBF8.description: Describe and discover vulnerabilities to and mitigate network attacks. (e.g., Man-in-the-middle, DDoS, DoS, Replay, Smurf attack, Spoofing, Spam, Phishing, Spim, Spit and other attacks).

E85D7CEDBC7044B4981A3A6C9ED025B5.description: Describe, locate, and mitigate security threats (e.g., Adware, Viruses, Spyware, Trojan, Rootkits, Logic bomb, Botnets, Ransomware, Polymorphic malware).

AF6847CB2E9D4F90AD2EFD8C7CC05936.description: Apply the principles of secure Network Design (e.g., DMZ, Subnetting, NAT/PAT, Remote access, Telephony, Virtualization).

231C06F933994BF9B21017F82D3665C6.description: Mitigate network threats (e.g., Flood guards, Loop protection, Implicit deny, Network separation, Log analysis, Unified threat management, peripheral and removable media).

323F582D41A04F92A41AB93C4512747B.description: Monitor and manage network Unified Threat Management.

1920A546E1814B43A7CC13635D9D8A1B.description: Install and configure network security devices. (Protocol analyzers, Spam filter, UTM security appliances, URL filter, Content inspection, Malware inspection).

3BDD695B499B4AE489CD190DA32E1268.description: Manage PKI and certificates (Transport encryption, Non-repudiation, Hashing, Key escrow, Steganography, Digital signatures).

8C64D8CEC84345E7ACD1CFF0B2D90342.description: Apply wireless security configurations (e.g., Disable SSID broadcast, TKIP, CCMP, Antenna placement, Power level controls).

F2C2912D99754E4BBC4028FC8755A032.description: Apply principles of IPv4 and IPv6 securely.

183F31F6460344BA9AF58394880FFC15.description: Secure use of network Protocols (e.g., IPSec, SNMP, SSH, DNS, TLS, SSL, TCP/IP, FTPS, HTTPS, SCP, ICMP).

2149C23512E146B080F8EF05EDE3B74B.description: Setup and maintain secure roles and system management techniques (e.g., password, group, and user privilege policies and monitoring).

1E7A074A3E914D54A60432E58157248F.description: Setup a Secure Network: Setup and maintain network security.

722C3577BCD943AC9D89300BFAECEAF7.description: Differentiate between Server-side vs. client-side validation.

E71F9598CE3741B881D33E04B43893DF.description: Discover and mitigate common database vulnerabilities and attacks.

A74289F7ED3B4CD094FAFD1FA39BC858.description: Implement secure coding concepts (e.g., Error and exception handling, Input validation, Cross-site scripting prevention, Cross-site Request Forgery, (XSRF) prevention, OWASP).

F24EAFEA56604F528AA27AEC85F309FE.description: Identify application vulnerabilities (e.g., Cross-site scripting, SQL injection, LDAP injection, XML injection, Directory traversal/command injection, Buffer overflow, Integer overflow, Zero-day, Cookies and attachments, Locally Shared Objects (LSOs), Flash cookies, Malicious add-ons, Session hijacking, Header manipulation, Arbitrary code execution/remote code execution).

68819E29606B4B68ADC95F18F74F58C9.description: Application Development Security: Develop and maintain application security.

4C679DC5C3C24D15A204713200B06460.description: Implement perimeter security (e.g., Fencing, Proximity readers, Access list, Proper lighting, Mantraps, Video Surveillance, Signs, Guards, Barricades, Biometrics, Protected distribution (cabling), Alarms, Motion detection).

63F8FD8EF91E48388681940C4E433555.description: Mitigate security implications of third party connectivity and access.

FFEC65B5C79A461796060E81006515FC.description: Implement authentication techniques (e.g., Tokens, Common access card, Smart card, Multifactor authentication, Single sign-on, Biometrics, Personal identification verification card, Username, Federation, Transitive trust/authentication).

2F7ED0813D2B42ABAA58400DE5578992.description: Perform authorization control (e.g., least privilege, separation of duties, mandatory access, discretionary access, rule-based access control, role-based access control, time of day restrictions, location distractions).

B76BD1C6CD264BACAB8A456828BA696D.description: Identify types of controls (e.g., Deterrent, Preventive, Detective, Compensating, Technical, and Administrative).

86E86EB9F6114BFAACC5C3E810405610.description: Mitigate threats by remaining abreast of industry information.

CD14E3A5DD01426986972255BD14F942.description: Maintain data security using data labeling, handling and, disposal as prescribed by policy and law.

88C290D688134B26803B51AE1C4E1A58.description: Describe the concepts of malware attack vectors.

3D0F1CA0AF394050855AA4142781E8FB.description: Identify the goals, objectives and purposes of Cyber Security.

A0EA15248FC54C82A4B81640CCB36D81.description: Cyber Security: Examine and employ principles of cyber security.

7E805370515E4226847055B2991AE808.description: Cyber Security: Learners apply principles of cybersecurity to secure and defend information technology systems, selection and implementation of methods and tools to secure physical and digital assets, mange threats, deploy countermeasures, and establish strategies to protect business information using risk and incident management.

BD3E564FAB8D47FD9237C956DC403DFD.description: Establish a process for archiving files.

EAF24ED8315741FBB75FA393D23FD95C.description: Identify the criteria for selecting a backup system.

C25A36FFFBFB4959AF23DE1966B10C24.description: Disaster Recovery: Recommend disaster recovery and business continuity plans.

0B7C9A644E484EB99B7279521CF7EA7D.description: Provision cloud services (e.g., Software as a Service [SaaS], Platform as a Service [PaaS], Infrastructure as a Service [IaaS], Security as a Service).

E4A16059A5E54E05AE88767FB44CD36B.description: Describe a Virtual Private Network (VPN) and identify associated protocols (e.g., Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol [L2TP], Point-to-Point Tunneling Protocol [PPTP]).

AB69A7943E5D466BB88F34D857BF435C.description: Wireless Network Solutions: Design and implement wireless network solutions.

661BE704552A46B9A5CD4C07676F5F60.description: Infrastructure Systems: Learners apply principles of networking and infrastructure related to the installation, administration, and maintenance of computer networks and components. Knowledge and skills may be applied to network connectivity, cabling, protocols, architecture, classification, topologies, operating systems, Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) standards, data encoding, Quality of Service (QoS), Internet Protocol (IP) addressing, and wide area network (WAN) design.

3A2FA99F3851490EB201F92057200C8B.description: Implement and test the security of a wireless network.

F7CE5046176F4C0D8415C9D8B5798041.description: Describe security practices and policies for personal devices.

4255FC77D0764635968E68E0BAD18348.description: Describe practices and policies for preventing and detecting installation of rogue networks.

6678AA827FCB4065890E5C42CF99459A.description: Research security enhancements provided by Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE).

9C194EF79B024005A0C2B235010E6313.description: Compare methods of increasing the security of wireless networks and devices (e.g., Media Access Control [MAC] address filtering, Wi-Fi Protected Access [WPA], 802.1x, Remote Authentication Dial In User Service [RADIUS]).

6390F8B12F744418BC99A846B900BCF9.description: Wireless Security: Implement secure wireless networks.

0364D75E72FD4C4BBEA066CA52228137.description: Train users in network security procedures.

1A71522FDC4F43899BFE3E7E680F5843.description: Assess risks based on vulnerability of the organization, likelihood of risk, and impact on the organization.

3D8C5CC4AE904DA39B209ACFD0AC4D4C.description: Describe network security policies (e.g., acceptable use policy).

C42A720540DF47918AE830A41F397535.description: Network Security: Implement and maintain network security.

CF392B927C534995A01F64425AE660C9.description: Provide documentation, training, and support to users on established security procedures.

5BC40A2CD7F54DA68244B4379863EF50.description: Identify sources of virus and malware infection and remove viruses and malware.

2C3B955F477B4AE486914615C99160B7.description: Install, test, implement, and update virus and malware detection and protection software.

029A15947550492CB538B26EAB7DEBD0.description: Provide user authentication (e.g., assign and reset user accounts and passwords).

2F682908A4EE4D8CA6405C7BE599CA24.description: Identify and implement data and application security.

480D29051B42405299013924C5A7B797.description: Implement and maintain general security compliance.: Describe the components associated with information security systems.

F4C04664228C4858857496434FBFDAD0.description: Compare authentication techniques (e.g. single factor, multifactor, passwords, biometrics, certificates, Radio Frequency Identification [RFID] cards).

CDAE428F534A4CBE9453B6312D54FDCE.description: Components of Information Security: Describe the components associated with information security systems.

F92C899AB09C40BF98D614DE3F63D653.description: Information Security: Learners apply principles of information security to implement and maintain security compliance and network security. Learners select components and mechanisms required for a multilayer defense structure and evaluate and minimize security risks to wired and wireless networks and devices.

54109171C3B240D3B15142BC6C4C86BB.description: Describe privacy security compliance on systems (e.g., Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act [HIPAA], Payment Card Industry [PCI], Sarbanes Oxley Act [SOX], Americans with Disabilities Act [ADA], General Data Protection Regulation [GDPR], European                                                                                                                                                                                           Union Data Protection Regulation [EUDPR]).

6E506E51E74D4FF1A9289CB44C2092AC.description: Practice information security per job requirements.

99F7E81ABCD94083BEFAD85E3F8B0B25.description: Describe computer forensics, its importance in information security and cybersecurity, and its relevance to law enforcement.

6CD2B6AB6E2846E286EB6AC930D53656.description: Describe major threats to computer systems (e.g., insider threats, viruses, worms, spyware, ransomware, spoofing, hacking, social engineering, phishing).

357BEFA5C65B447FAAD46DDBC14706CE.description: Identify security risks and describe associated safeguards and methodologies (e.g., auditing).

D92E05D5568B4954AF876241CAC173C0.description: Security, Risks, and Safeguards: Describe the need for security and explain security risks and security safeguards.

7AE4E7F656A64E2AB8226690F175BC6B.description: IT Fundamentals: Learners apply fundamental principles of IT, including the history of IT and its impact on society, common industry terms, systems theory, information storage and retrieval, database management, and computer hardware, software, and peripheral device configuration and installation. This base of knowledge and skills may be applied across the career field.

E24F80B104554E2CB1BF2EDD540B7BB7.description: Apply physical and virtual situational awareness (e.g., clean desk policies, shoulder surfing, social engineering, tailgating).

3B34F0A9BD9A4719A1A165711C442281.description: Differentiate between appropriate and inappropriate information.

E3C7D4FE9C4F449C861AF54935D7ADD5.description: Cyber Hygiene: Apply digital information security principles to keep information secure.

AB70828433F642BA8A8B1925209A8C5F.description: Business Operations/21st Century Skills: Learners apply principles of economics, business management, marketing, and employability in an entrepreneur, manager, and employee role to the leadership, planning, developing, and analyzing of business enterprises related to the career field.
